text: it wasn't one single moment when I
realized I wanted to be an entrepreneur
I didn't grow up thinking that was my
destiny I just knew I wanted to make a
dent in the universe I decided to take
the plunge for the grommet really at a
specific moment I was meeting with an
entrepreneur somebody it was a stranger
I've never seen sense but I described
for him the basic idea of the company
leveling the playing field so the best
products could win you think social
media using video and he turned to me
and said you should do that
one of the best things I can offer the
students is real-world entrepreneurial
experience in a consumer facing and b2b
startup with a heavy digital marketing
component social media as well as
building a community students most want
to know two things for me they want to
know is this idea good one and am I cut
out to pursue a startup I can help with
those firstly I think it's really
important to work on a very large idea
because it will consume your life and
your life is worth a lot so I like to
see a hair on fire problem with a very
large market opportunity and I like to
see something original I'm more
comfortable with original ideas on the
personal decision you know am I cut out
for this I like to look for evidence of
entrepreneurial activity prior to
starting a company it could be things
like moving across country it could be
things like paying for college it could
be being the person who shows up when
somebody's sick and actually making you
know making the hard choices to be that
person it's often be much murders often
about choosing the harder path as
opposed to the more obvious or easier
path
you
